neighbors.name: Spare Bernard T & Debra E Living Tr
neighbors.influence_justification: Multigenerational local farming family with no known public office or corporate presence

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Bernard and Debra Spare through personal outreach; acknowledge their long-term stewardship of the land and address any concerns about impacts to their farmland

neighbors.name: Myers Warren David & Vickie Diane Rev Trust
neighbors.influence_justification: Private family trust of local landowners; no visible community leadership roles or large holdings

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Warren and Vickie Myers directly with respectful, face-to-face communication focusing on addressing their concerns about land use and property impacts

neighbors.name: J And M Trust
neighbors.influence_justification: Anonymous personal trust with no known public profile or influence in local affairs

approach_recommendations.engage: Identify the trustees or beneficiaries and reach out personally; ensure their questions about the project’s effect on their land and community are fully addressed

overview_summary: All three neighboring landowners are private family trusts holding farmland, rather than developer or corporate entities (e.g., the Spare family’s trust is held by a long-time local farming family) [Great Bend Tribune](https://www.gbtribune.com/news/local-news/education/spare-family-named-kansas-state-universitys-2016-family-of-the-year/). None of these trusts show any public involvement in development or political activities, so their stance on the project is not documented in available sources. They appear to have limited formal influence in the community beyond their status as landowners.
